糖果 [ táng guǒ ]: candy; Classifiers: 粒

白糖 [ bái táng ]: (refined) white sugar

heisig_chinese_memo: Tangy rice has extra sugar in it and goes bad quickly. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: sugar, rice, T’ang, cave, rake, mouth
koohiiStory1: Sugar made from rice has a tangy flavour.
koohiiStory2: The T´ang are the ones who began using sugar in China--of course, the first thing they tried it on was rice.
WaniKani_Radicals: 米, 广, 聿, 口
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Bring rice under a canopy, crush it with your brush, and sweep the white powder in your mouth... it's sugar now! You make sugar by carefully crushing rice to a powder, until it's small enough to brush into your mouth.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Taste the sugar in your mouth and feel the breeze waft under the canopy. You're surrounded by rice, but what's in your mouth is definitely sugar now.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You learned how to make sugar in とうきょう. You found a special とうきょう sugar sensei and they introduced you to all of the secret methods you know now.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: As you eat the sugar, you picture とうきょう. The place where you fell in love with these sugar-making techniques.
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 唐 (から、トウ Китай, династия Тан).
Ru_Radicals: 口 (рот), 广 (скала с точкой), 米 (рис)
Ru_trainchinese: táng: (сущ) сахар; конфеты, сладости; (хим.) углевод, карбогидрат
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the rice (米) from the T'ang Dynasty (唐) has turned into sugar
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Tangy rice has extra sugar in it and goes bad quickly. &nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
From " m " to " Tang " sound. The original meaning is malt sugar, which is a sweet substance extracted from sugar cane, rice, sugar beet, etc. "Shuowen Xinfu": "Sugar, glutinous rice. From rice, Tang Sheng." Such as "Qi Min Yao Shu. "Sugarcane" quotes "The History of Foreign Matters": "The sugarcane produced by Jiaozhi is very mellow, without any thickness, and its taste is even. It is a few inches in circumference, and it is more than ten feet long, quite like bamboo. Cut and eat it, it is sweet; Sugar, its name is "sugar," and it is also beneficial to the treasure." Northern Song Dynasty Su Shi "Send a monk from Jinshan Township to Shu to open a church": "Ice plate recommended amber, how beautiful is it like icing.

" Sugar " also means candy. Such as "Awakening the World Constantly. "The oil seller monopolizes the oiran": "Don’t say you can’t grow your hair, just have a few dollars in your purse. In your free time, you can buy melon seeds and buy sugar to eat. If your two legs are broken, you have to buy cloth with him. Miles." Chapter 14 of "The Scholars": "There are many dishes on the cabinet: orange cake, sesame candy, zongzi, sesame seed, sliced slices, black dates, boiled chestnuts."

Modern Chinese " sugar " also means a kind of organic compound that makes the human body produce heat. It is divided into monosaccharides, disaccharides and polysaccharides, such as "glucose", "sucrose", and "lactose".
humanum_short_description_en: From " m " to " tang " sound. The original meaning is malt sugar, which is a sweet substance extracted from sugar cane, rice, sugar beet, etc.
humanum_full_description:
從「米」，「唐」聲。本義是飴糖，即從甘蔗、米、甜菜等提煉出來的甜的物質。《說文新附》：「糖，飴也。从米，唐聲。」如《齊民要術．甘蔗》引《異物志》：「交趾所產甘蔗特醇好，本末無薄厚，其味至均。圍數寸，長丈餘，頗似竹。斬而食之，既甘；迮取汁為飴餳，名之曰『糖』，益復珍也。」北宋蘇軾〈送金山鄉僧歸蜀開堂〉：「冰盤薦琥珀，何似糖霜美。」

　　「糖」後亦表示糖果。如《醒世恒言．賣油郎獨占花魁》：「不要說不會生發，就是有幾文錢在荷包裏，閒時買瓜子磕，買糖兒喫，兩條腳帶破了，還要做媽的與他買布哩。」《儒林外史》第14回：「櫃上擺著許多碟子：橘餅、芝麻糖、粽子、燒餅、處片、黑棗、煮栗子。」

　　現代漢語「糖」還表示有機化合物的一種，使人體產生熱量，分為單糖、雙糖和多糖，例如「葡萄糖」、「蔗糖」、「乳糖」等。
humanum_short_description: 從「米」，「唐」聲。本義是飴糖，即從甘蔗、米、甜菜等提煉出來的甜的物質。

從「 米 」，「 唐 」聲。本義是飴糖，即從甘蔗、米、甜菜等提煉出來的甜的物質。《說文新附》：「糖，飴也。从米，唐聲。」如《齊民要術．甘蔗》引《異物志》：「交趾所產甘蔗特醇好，本末無薄厚，其味至均。圍數寸，長丈餘，頗似竹。斬而食之，既甘；迮取汁為飴餳，名之曰『糖』，益復珍也。」北宋蘇軾〈送金山鄉僧歸蜀開堂〉：「冰盤薦琥珀，何似糖霜美。」 「 糖 」後亦表示糖果。如《醒世恒言．賣油郎獨占花魁》：「不要說不會生發，就是有幾文錢在荷包裏，閒時買瓜子磕，買糖兒喫，兩條腳帶破了，還要做媽的與他買布哩。」《儒林外史》第14回：「櫃上擺著許多碟子：橘餅、芝麻糖、粽子、燒餅、處片、黑棗、煮栗子。」 現代漢語「 糖 」還表示有機化合物的一種，使人體產生熱量，分為單糖、雙糖和多糖，例如「葡萄糖」、「蔗糖」、「乳糖」等。

糖字的基本解释

糖
táng
从甘蔗、甜菜、米、麦等提制出来的甜的物质：白糖。红糖。冰糖。糖浆。糖稀。糖膏。糖瓜儿。糖房（旧时制糖的作坊。亦称“糖寮”、“榨寮”）。糖衣。
碳水化合物，有机化合物的一类，分为“单糖”、“双糖”三种，是人体内产生热能的主要物质：糖元。糖尿病（因人体内胰岛素分泌不足所引起。是一种以体内糖代谢紊乱、血糖增高为主的慢性疾病）。

糖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［táng］
［《廣韻》徒郎切，平唐，定。］
亦作“糛1”。“餳2”的今字。
(1)食糖。古代以麦作饴，即麦芽糖。后多用甘蔗、甜菜等制糖。
(2)糖果。
(3)有机化合物的一类。分为单糖、双糖和多糖三种，是人体内产生热能的主要物质，例如葡萄糖、蔗糖、乳糖、淀粉等等。

糖字的英文翻译

◎ 糖
candy, sugar

糖字的康熙字典解释

【未集上】【米字部】　糖； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页911第38
【廣韻】【集韻】?徒郞切，音唐。【說文】飴也。【揚子·方言】餳謂之糖。　又沙糖。【易林】南箕無舌飯多沙糖。　又糖霜。【王灼·糖霜譜】唐大曆閒，有僧號鄒和尙者，不知從來。跨白驢，登繖山，結茅以居。須鹽米薪菜之屬，卽書付紙，繫錢，遣驢負至市，人知爲鄒也，取平直挂物於鞍，縱驢歸。一日驢犯山下黃氏蔗田，黃請償于鄒。鄒曰：汝未知窨蔗爲糖霜，利當十倍。試之，果信。鄒末年走通泉縣靈鷲山龕中，其徒追躡及之，但見一文殊石像。衆始知大士化身，而白驢者師子也。　【篇海】亦作糛、餹。【六書音義】糛、?同。

糖字的源字形

糖字的起名意思

用甘蔗、甜菜或米麦等提制出来的甜东西。

sugar
Basic explanation of words
sugar
táng
The sweet substance extracted from sugar cane, sugar beet, rice, wheat, etc.: white sugar. brown sugar. crystal sugar. syrup. Syrup. Massecuite. Sugar Guar. Sugar Room (the old sugar workshop. Also known as "Sugar Liao", "Zhang Liao"). Icing.
Carbohydrates, a category of organic compounds, are divided into "monosaccharides" and "disaccharides". They are the main substance that generates heat in the human body: glycogen. Diabetes (caused by insufficient insulin secretion in the human body. It is a chronic disease mainly caused by disorders of glucose metabolism and increased blood sugar in the body).
sugar
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［táng］
["Guangyun" Tu Langqie, Ping Tang, Ding. ]
Also known as "糛1". The modern word for "Sugar 2".
(1) Sugar. In ancient times, wheat was used as malt, that is, maltose. Later, sugar cane and sugar beets are used to make sugar.
(2) Candy.
(3) A class of organic compounds. It is divided into three kinds of monosaccharides, disaccharides and polysaccharides, which are the main substances that produce heat energy in the human body, such as glucose, sucrose, lactose, starch and so on.
sugar
English translation of words
◎ Sugar
candy, sugar
sugar

[Uncollected first] [Rice character department] 　tang; Kangxi strokes: 16; Page number: page 911 38

[Wang Zhuo·Frosting Spectrum] Tang Dali Xian, there is a monk named Zou He Su, I don’t know how to do it. Cross the white donkey, climb the umbrella mountain, and live together. One day the donkey committed a crime against Huang's sugarcane field at the foot of the mountain, and Huang asked Zou for compensation. Пиктофонетические символы.
Рис выражает значение, что означает, что карамельный сахар сделан из риса и пшеницы; Тан (танг) выражает звук, Тан имеет большое значение, используя рисовую пшеницу, чтобы приготовить сахар на пару, а затем ферментировать, чтобы объем стал больше.

Radicals: 米, 广, 聿, 口  (rice, canopy, brush, mouth)
Meaning Mnemonic
Bring rice under a canopy, crush it with your brush, and sweep the white powder in your mouth... it's sugar now! You make sugar by carefully crushing rice to a powder, until it's small enough to brush into your mouth.
Taste the sugar in your mouth and feel the breeze waft under the canopy. You're surrounded by rice, but what's in your mouth is definitely sugar now.
Reading Mnemonic
You learned how to make sugar in とうきょう. You found a special とうきょう sugar sensei and they introduced you to all of the secret methods you know now.
As you eat the sugar, you picture とうきょう. The place where you fell in love with these sugar-making techniques.
